sources.title: The Black Castle (1952)
sources.description: The Black Castle is a 1952 horror film set in a mythical European locale during the 18th century. The story follows Lord Edward, portrayed by Richard Greene , who embarks on a journey to rescue his abducted love, a lady named Margaret. Lord Edward's quest is motivated by his love for Margaret, who has been captured by the malevolent Count von Bruno, a sadistic nobleman. The narrative unfolds around the eerie and foreboding Black Castle, where the Count conducts mysterious and sinister rituals involving tortured souls. Edward is joined by his loyal friend, played by Lon Chaney Jr. , as they unravel the dark secrets of the castle and confront supernatural elements.As they penetrate deeper into the castle, they face various challenges, including betrayal and the Count's nefarious plans. The film culminates in a tense and thrilling confrontation to save Margaret and defeat the Count.

metadata.Plot: Man investigates the disappearance of two of his friends who were the guests of a sinister Austrian count.
metadata.Actors: Richard Greene, Boris Karloff, Stephen McNally
